noun.description: A member of a people living on the banks of the Yuat River in the East Sepik Province of Papua New Guinea. Now more commonly called Biwat.
Frequently in form Munduguma. The Sepik-Ramu language of the Mundugumor people. Now usually called Biwat.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Mundugumor or their language.

origin: 1930s; earliest use found in Margaret Mead (1901–1978), anthropologist. From Biwat Mundugumor, former self-designation.
